text: Legislative elections were held in the German Democratic Republic on 14 June 1981. 500 deputies to the Volkskammer were elected, with all of them being candidates of the single-list National Front. 679 Front candidates were put forward, with 500 being elected and 179 becoming substitute deputies. At its first session on 25 June, the Volkskammer re-elected Willi Stoph as Chairman of the Council of Ministers, while Erich Honecker, General Secretary of the ruling Socialist Unity Party, was also re-elected Chairman of the Council of State. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right |- !Alliance !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/- |- | rowspan="9" align="left" |National Front|| align="left" |Socialist Unity Party of Germany|| rowspan="9" |12,235,515|| rowspan="9" |99.9||127||0 |- | align="left" |Free German Trade Union Federation||68||0 |- | align="left" |Christian Democratic Union||52||0 |- | align="left" |Liberal Democratic Party of Germany||52||0 |- | align="left" |National Democratic Party of Germany||52||0 |- | align="left" |Democratic Farmers' Party of Germany||52||0 |- | align="left" |Free German Youth||40||0 |- | align="left" |Democratic Women's League of Germany||35||0 |- | align="left" |Cultural Association of the GDR||22||0 |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Against||16,613||0.1||–||– |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Invalid/blank votes||2,878||–||–||– |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Total||12,255,006||100||500||0 |- | colspan="2" align="left" |Registered voters/turnout||12,352,263||99.2||–||– |- | colspan="6" align="left" |Source: IPU |} ==References== * Inter-Parliamentary Union: HISTORICAL ARCHIVE OF PARLIAMENTARY ELECTION RESULTS - Germany * Richard Felix Staar.
